TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 82-83

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 82-83

div1.p: Mr James Austin tells me that your powder had Arrived, and that you had promis'd to Keep the Hundred pounds you Sold me Until monday Week I have about 1200 lb Lead now in St Genevieve in Boxes in Small Barrs Which you may have and the Balance you shall have by the time Mr. James Austin Promis'd you so that I shall Depend on the powder the Lead in Boxes will be Six Dollars pr Hundred its in Small Barrs—
